page.title: 15Murton Livestock Centre
page.content: Animal auctions are held at York Livestock Centre. It was for many years just outside the York city walls but when that area was re-developed, in 1971, the centre was moved to its present position 3 miles East of York near to the by-pass, giving easy access. Farmers have attended auctions from as far away as Lincolnshire, Cheshire and Middlesbrough. An average attendance is 2000 farmers. Monday auctions are for slaughter and Thursday for store animals. Dalgety Meat's abattoir is near-by. The maximum number of cattle each week is about 1000 though it usually about 600, with 2500 pigs and 1000 sheep. The maximum price paid was Â£8400 for a pedigree cow and calf. On sale days 3 banks open, and 6 shops of agricultural needs and a bar.
